newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA-C.BANK SUSPENDS THE POWERS OF TAURAS CHAIRMAN.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA-C.BANK SUSPENDS THE POWERS OF TAURAS CHAIRMAN.

text.p: Lithuania's central bank said on Thursday that its board decided to suspend the powers of the chairman of Tauras Bank and to remove the bank's board.
The statement also said that it imposed a temporary ban on some of the troubled bank's activities.

"It was decided to ban Tauras Bank, untill July 12, from carrying out the following banking operations: to accept deposits, issue financial guarantees, and deal with government T-bills," the central bank said.

The central bank also banned Tauras from conducting transactions with foreign currencies, buying or selling precious metals, issuing payment documents, and managing individual loans, the statement said.
The central bank also recomended the appointment of a new board as soon as possibile to deal with the bank's urgent problems, the statement added.
"The supervision department of the Bank of Lithuania was empowered to audit the financial situation of Tauras Bank," the statement said.
Tauras Bank confirmed last month that it was facing liquidity problems and borrowed around 14 million litas from the Bank of Lithuania.
Tauras was pinning its hopes on an upcoming share issue of 40 million litas.
The share capital of Tauras Bank is 36 million litas and its assets at the end of April were 187.2 million litas.
Its deposits and letters of credit were 126.2 million litas at the end of April.
The central bank said that Tauras's problems would not ripple through the rest of the sector, which was shaken in late 1995 by a severe crisis.

"I think that the banking system will not be affected by Tauras Bank's problems, since the bank is not very big and today's decision was no surprise to financial markets," said Gitanas Nauseda, the head of the Bank of Lithuania's policy department.
